page.title: 05 YOUTH ACTIVITIES.
page.content: Denton and Hackleton both have Youth Clubs which meet once a week in their village halls. The Baden-Powell movements are also active in the villages and there is much competition for cups and shields in the district swimming galas and athletic events. The Scout troops belong to the Castle Ashby District while the Guides are in the Salcey Division. Hackleton has a Brownie Pack, 2 Guide Companies,a Cub Scout Pack,a Scout Troop and a Venture Scout unit. In Denton the Beaver colony for small boys (between 6&8 years) and the Cub Scouts meet in the village hall. The Brownies meet at Brafield hall while the Scouts, Ventures and Guides are helping parents to build a new headquarters for Guides and Scouts at Little Houghton.
